ygData.messageBody:
>From: JW IV <phule@...>
>I can't help but feel greatly aggravated at the number of people who sit
>there and camp at the ruins in the hopes of taking advantage of monks who
>desperately need putrid rib bones. I find this amazingly lame.

I personally find it interesting. Free enterprise at work. It is lame if it
gets to the point that they are stealing kills from monks and then trying
to sell them back to the monks. That's taking advantage.

> It ranks up
>there with clerics charging for heals and other such things.

Why does this bother you? You are asking a favor of somebody. You don't
have to pay. Clerics aren't there for your convience. How about charging
for binding? Or having somebody help find your corpse? Is this lame as
well? I can understand that it would be lame if the cleric is in your own
party and charges you. I would dump that party member awful quick.

>It's like a tank charging to party with you or some other such nonsense.

No, its like paying a tank to take something out for you if you can't and
they aren't in your party. I believe the difference lies in whether you are
partied or not. One is working for the profit of the whole, the other is a
favor. I once died in a very sticky situation and there was no way I'ld
every be able to retrieve my stuff. I had a tank go in and get it for me,
and glady payed the individual (even though they didn't ask), knowing that
it wasn't something they particularly wanted to do.

>Those clerics who do keep it free have my undying loyalty.

I am a cleric and I gladly heal for free. And undying loyalty is greatly
appreciated as well :) It's part of the reason I chose to be a cleric. You
always have a friend. However, I've encountered players who seem to think
that's all I do, or that I somehow *owe* them. I'll be kneedeep in gnolls
in black burrow, mana half gone, in a party, and get a tell "Can you heal
me?" When I finally meet up with the individual all they need is to be
"topped off" hp-wise. <grrr> It's repeat cases with individuals like these
that I'll ask for donations :)

As long as they aren't screwing other people in the process, I feel that if
people have a service other people want, I think its their perogative to
charge for it.

-Rebecca
Seby, 10th level cleric who will happily heal in exchange for gratitude
